fields.value: Replication Data for: Medical versus surgical treatment of first trimester spontaneous abortion: a cost-minimization analysis.

dsDescriptionValue.value: Both medical and surgical abortions are commonly used in developed countries. However, the costs of these two methods have not been compared. Here, cost-minimization analysis of the 2 methods was performed, based on all charges for the overall procedures in an out-patient clinic in Castilla y León, Spain. In conclusion, the medical treatment of first-trimester abortion with misoprostol is a cost-efficient alternative to surgical treatment. Given its demonstrable safety, effectiveness and tolerance, it is a reasonable therapeutic option and should be prioritized in evacuation curettage in patients who meet the treatment criteria.

publicationCitation.value: Medical versus surgical treatment of first trimester spontaneous abortion: a cost-minimization analysis. Ana María Cubo, Zandra Mileny Soto, Ana María Haro , Estrella Hernández , María José Doyague and José María Sayagués. PLOS ONE. 2018 in press
